pr_title: [BAQE-1323] DB scripts move to a new module along with refactoring work in jbpm-installer

timeline.message:
- Reuse and refactor of jbpm-installer classes and moved/refactored to jbpm-util-test module along with some dependency classes from jbpm-persistence module
- Split of jbpm-installer into a new jbpm-db-script module to reuse and share DB sql scripts.
- Adding jbpm-test-coverage to the Jenkins db matrix job.

- Reuse and refactor of jbpm-installer classes and moved/refactored to jbpm-util-test module along with some dependency classes from jbpm-persistence module
- Split of jbpm-installer into a new jbpm-db-script module to reuse and share DB sql scripts.
- Adding jbpm-test-coverage to the Jenkins db matrix job.

- Split of jbpm-installer into a new jbpm-db-script module to reuse and share DB sql scripts.
- Adding jbpm-test-coverage to the Jenkins db matrix job.

- Split of jbpm-installer into a new jbpm-db-script module to reuse and share DB sql scripts.

- Split of jbpm-installer into a new jbpm-db-script module to reuse and share DB sql scripts.

timeline.bodyText: This is a good chance to remove star imports :) as we don't encourage people to use them.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Sure, I will change them.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Actually these star imports were already there, I only changed the package name. But anyway, removing these star imports from the classes.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Actually these star imports were already there, I only changed the package name. But anyway, removing these star imports from the classes.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Yes, I know :) Just thought that it might be a good time to eliminate them.
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Because I've already included a call to the reusable class in charge of creating the DB schemas: ScriptsBase.executeScriptRunner(DB_DDL_SCRIPTS_RESOURCE_PATH, false); from the parent class TimerBaseTest
Though, I think for the time being I will comment it out as this piece of work is still in progress (works fine, but some tests are still failing due to many different reasons) and will be delivered in next PRs.
What do you think? I mean, there is no harm of having this call here but I'm open to comment it out for the moment.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText:
I see... Though now when you look at it, we call a method (tearDownOnce()) which has @BeforeClass annotation on it also in @before method. I think it would be good to make it more clear. But that is just cosmetics.
However, I see that now the schema is created/scripts are run in GlobalQuartzRAMTimerServiceTest which stores timers in RAM rather than DB, but there are no such operations in GlobalQuartzDBTimerServiceTest. Shouldn't it be the other way round that we should create schema in DB tests and for RAM it is not needed?
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
I would say tearDownOnce() call in @before method is not needed there, since it will be called in the @after method. I think the tearDownOnce() call is needed in the @after method because it is supposed to be a RAM based database (i.e. database is created and destroy after every test method).
But yes, it shouldn't create/run any SQL script for this case.
In the other hand, GlobalQuartzDBTimerServiceTest, the SQL scripts are created/destroyed once in the @afterclass and @BeforeClass respectively in the class TimerBaseTest.
However all of these changes are still in progress and will be delivered in the next upcoming PR.
What do you think?
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Understand. Then I guess it would be probably good to not alter these classes at all? So leave them as they were, do only necessary changes so we don't mix it?
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Agree.
Will revert unnecessary changes for now.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: I think that here we can make an exception because this TestEventEmitter is afaik not used in two or more modules for testing. It should be only needed in the jbpm-persistence module tests. What do you think?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
It is used in the jbpm-test-coverage module - class org.jbpm.test.functional.task.ProcessHumanTaskTest.
So I would agree if there was no reference to this class but having more than 1 references, I would keep it in the jbpm-test-util module now.
Would you agree?
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: True, sorry for a false alert :) Yes, we can leave it as is.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: In this one, there is no reference outside jbpm-persistence-jpa module but IMO I would move all these classes to the jbpm-test-util module just for coherence along classes in the same package. What do you think?
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: OK.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: Maybe update the docs so we know what is the difference between TestPersistenceContext and TestPersistenceContextBase?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Agree. Will update the docs accordingly.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: I think that these entities and also WorkItemHandlers are used specifically for jbpm-persistence tests, aren't they? In that case I think we can leave them in the jbpm-persistence module.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
I agree.
Will revert these classes
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Is this needed? My understanding by the name of the class is that no getters/setters should be present.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Can't recall now why this was added but as we agreed to keep these classes in the jbpm-persistence module I won't make any of these changes.
Reverting this back.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Probably again used just in jbpm-persistence tests?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
This class is used by TestPersistenceContextBase class (one of the class we want to reuse) and it was located in the jbpm-installer module originally (now in the jbpm-test-util).
So this ProcessCreatorForHelp class is used by two classes, one in the jbpm-persistence  and one in the jbpm-test-util module.
I would keep it in jbpm-test-util. What do you think?
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Ah, then it's fine.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: I guess jbpm-xes module then doesn't need to depend on jbpm-persistence-jpa test-jar artifact?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Nice catch!
Removing jbpm-persistence-jpa dependencies from pom.xml (not needed)
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: afalhambra
